page.title: 14Wyre Forest - Leisure
page.content: The Wyre Forest is used by many people with varying interests. Walking is the most popular, either in family groups, exercising dogs, or large rambling clubs of up to 200. Maps and leaflets are available from a Visitors' Centre, and bridle paths are clearly defined for horse riding. Car parks and picnic areas are provided, though camping and lighting fires are strictly forbidden. School parties visit the forest to learn about the flora and fauna. Ornithologists and entomologists study their subjects and orienteers can often be seen at weekends. When not being used for car rallies or large-scale sponsored walks the forest is a haven of peace and tranquillity, and part of a beautiful landscape, on the edge of the densely populated West Midlands.
